Description: Lip sherd, with turn to wall, of Laconian, probably black-figured pottery kylix; slightly convex lip; dull cream slip; interior glazed black (partly flaked) with three thin bands in added red below lip; exterior: reserved with frieze of void rays; black band below; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.651 and 1886,0401.652. Johnston (2014, 105) notes that the same name is found on other dedications, all of which possibly belong to the same person. See Oxford AN1912.41 and British Museum 1888,0601.421. The sherd is also published in Stibbe, C. 'Lakonische Keramik aus dem Heraion von Samos', Mitteilungen des Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts, Athenische Abteilung 112, 1997, 129-130, pl. 16,1-2. Johnston, A.W. 2014. ‘Naukratis, Aegina and Laconia; some individuals and pottery distribution’, in A. Tsingarida (ed.) Pottery Markets in the Ancient Greek World. Proceedings of the International Symposium held at the Université libre de Bruxelles. Bruxelles. 103-12.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 340)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 671, no. 301)
Johnston 2006b / The Delta: From Gamma to Zeta (p. 24, fig. 6a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.29) (Phase 1)
